item.title: Mcgyver5 add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description:
"The regime had understood that one person leaving her house while asking herself: Are my trousers long enough?' Is my veil in place?' Can my make-up be seen?' Are they going to whip me?'
No longer asks herself:
Where is my freedom of thought?' Where is my freedom of speech?' My life, is it livable?' What's going on in the political prisons?" -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: Mcgyver5 add a quote by Stephen Hawking
item.description: "There is a fundamental difference between religion, which is based on authority, and science, which is based on observation and reason. Science will win because it works." -- Stephen Hawking

item.title: Mcgyver5 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mcgyver5 add a quote by Stanislaw Lem
item.description: "When smashing monuments, save the pedestals. They always come in handy." -- Stanislaw Lem

item.title: Mcgyver5 add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Mcgyver5 add a quote by Ozzie Zehner
item.description: "Wind is renewable. Turbines are not." -- Ozzie Zehner

item.title: Mcgyver5 add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "But the first lesson reading teaches is how to be alone." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Mcgyver5 add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "The smart way to keep people passive and obedient is to strictly limit the spectrum of acceptable opinion, but allow very lively debate within that spectrum...." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Mcgyver5 add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Never let a good crisis go to waste" -- Winston Churchill
